title: Trying to fix a bug in the application which only occurs immediately after a…
message: Trying to fix a bug in the application which only occurs immediately after a clean installation and before any settings have been saved. The final breakpoint was (by default) set at 3600 seconds rather than the desired 600. I'm sure this was an artifact from prior testing, probably when I was testing the time formatting beyond one hour.

title: Deleted the Rakefile, which turned out to be useless. Replaced it with a simple…
message: Deleted the Rakefile, which turned out to be useless. Replaced it with a simple build.sh wrapper that executes the appropriate ant commands in order.

message: Made some very small tweaks to some of the UI elements. Fixed a formatting issue whereby minutes would not be padded with leading zeros even if the timer had run longer than one hour.

message: Made a fix to presentation-timer.js to allow the terminal color settings to be respected. Previously they were being ignored.

title: Made it possible to specify start and end colors and action.
message: Made it possible to specify start and end colors and action.

title: Fixed what I believe to be an existing bug which could crash the JavaScript…
message: Fixed what I believe to be an existing bug which could crash the JavaScript layer if a user deleted a non-final breakpoint. Also modified the application logic such that breakpoints are now re-drawn whenever settings are changed. This forces them to always be displayed to the user in chronological order, even if the user did not specify them as such.

title: Moved the JavaScript bindings that were implemented in index.html into the…
message: Moved the JavaScript bindings that were implemented in index.html into the document.ready() event in index.js.

message: Made some changes to .gitignore, because Phonegap just shat itself when it couldn't find project.properties and local.properties, which I had to recover from a file backup. I don't know why it stopped generating these files, but whatever.

title: Added a validator. It is now no longer possible to set a breakpoint whose…
message: Added a validator. It is now no longer possible to set a breakpoint whose elapsed time is 0. Also fixed a small bug whereby, if a form failed validation multiple times in a row, the errors where not being cleared between each failing.

title: Laid out the settings form differently. H/MM/SS breakpoint fields are now…
message: Laid out the settings form differently. H/MM/SS breakpoint fields are now stacked vertically rather than spread horitzontally. This should make them easier to use on mobile devices with small screens.

title: Removed some cruft at assets/www/res that shipped with the sample project. (I'm…
message: Removed some cruft at assets/www/res that shipped with the sample project. (I'm now confident I don't need it.) Did some extensive tuning and UI improvements for mobile devices. Made some minor bug fixes within the application logic. Left some comments detailing what remains to be done.

title: Got a pretty good color picker working now, I think.
message: Got a pretty good color picker working now, I think.

title: Modified app.bindEvents(). It now bootstraps the application differently based…
message: Modified app.bindEvents(). It now bootstraps the application differently based on whether it detects that it is running within a PhoneGap application or a standard web browser. This makes developing across multiple devices slightly easier, because it manages the 'deviceready' problem which would exist otherwsie.

title: Removed my attempt at a <select> based color-picker. Thinking this through,…
message: Removed my attempt at a <select> based color-picker. Thinking this through, there's no way this is going to work in a cross-browser compatible way. Worked fine in the browser, but I'm not going to press my luck with devices. I'll find a way to stay semantic.

title: Deleting more garbage from the project. Apparently no one on earth has ever…
message: Deleting more garbage from the project. Apparently no one on earth has ever created a functinoal color input polyfill.

title: Making some bugfixes and adjustments to the settings UI behavior. Including:…
message: Making some bugfixes and adjustments to the settings UI behavior. Including: user is now prompted when changing settings while timer is already running, and timer settings are now re-loaded when saved. This makes it possible for the timer to respect new settings without reloading the page (which is important, given that the app won't support any kind of 'reload' behavior.
